oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Brantley family grist mill
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Black and white photograph of the Brantley family grist mill on the Noah Fork. There are three women and two men in front of the mill. A creek can be seen.

The Websters family built the first mill, a corn mill, in Noah Fork between 1830 and 1840. The second mill on the site was washed away, therefore, in 1903 Samuel Brantley built the grist mill back from the creek. The working parts on the mill were those from the original Webster mill.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Families; Mills; Flour & meal industry; Streams
